  • Isaiah 66
1 The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; they that dwelt in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined. 2 Thou hast multiplied the nation, Thou hast increased their joy; they joy before Thee according to the joy in harvest, as women rejoice when they divide the spoil. 3 For the yoke of her burden, and the staff of her shoulder, the rod of her oppressor, Thou hast broken as in the day of Midian. 4 For every boot stamped with fierceness, and every cloak rolled in blood, shall even be for burning, for fuel of fire. 5 For a child is born unto us, a daughter is given unto us; and the government is upon her shoulder; and her name is called Pele-joez-el-gibbor-Abi-ad-sar-shalom; 6 That the government may be increased, and of peace there be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon her kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it through justice and through righteousness from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of the Domina of hosts doth perform this.

 7 The Domina sent a word into Jacoba, and it hath lighted upon Israel. 8 And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in pride and in arrogancy of heart: 9 'The bricks are fallen, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but cedars will we put in their place.' 10 Therefore the Domina doth set upon high the adversaries of Rezin against her, and spur her enemies;
11 The Arameans on the east, and the Philistines on the west; and they devour Israel with open mouth. For all this Her anger is not turned away, but Her hand is stretched out still. 12 Yet the people turneth not unto Her that smiteth them, neither do they seek the Domina of hosts.   13 Therefore the Domina doth cut off from Israel head and tail, palm-branch and rush, in one day. 14 The elder and the woman of rank, she is the head; and the prophetess that teacheth lies, she is the tail. 15 For they that lead this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed. 16 Therefore the Domina shall have no joy in their young women, neither shall She have compassion on their fatherless and widows; for every one is ungodly and an evil-doer, and every mouth speaketh wantonness. For all this Her anger is not turned away, but Her hand is stretched out still. 17 For wickedness burneth as the fire; it devoureth the briers and thorns; yea, it kindleth in the thickets of the forest, and they roll upward in thick clouds of smoke. 18 Through the wrath of the Domina of hosts is the land burnt up; the people also are as the fuel of fire; no woman spareth her sister. 19 And one snatcheth on the right hand, and is hungry; and she eateth on the left hand, and is not satisfied; they eat every woman the flesh of her own arm: 20 Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh; and they together are against Judah. For all this Her anger is not turned away, but Her hand is stretched out still.
